message.body: Have you ever gone canoeing?
random
It's only random to you. ^_^
no it's random. Gmornin' Liz, how are you?
I'm doing well. How are you?
Fine, thank you
and yes, I have been canoeing
Do you enjoy it?
I do
If you don't have previous plans, Would you be interested in going this weekend
I would be interested and very much appreciate the invitation, alas I do have other plans this weekend
Okay.
I am going up to the poconos
which ironically is a wonderful place to go canoeing and the like
Funny, all the stories I've heard about them solely consist of drinking.
But that's not really surprising, considering the people I heard the stories from.
there can be some of that as well
I don't recommend combining the drinking and the canoeing. That sounds dangerous. ^_^
but during the day it is quite beautiful up there. The water is crystal clear, cool, and inviting
the mountains tall and humbling
the trees thick and plentiful
the air fresh and crisp
and on a clear night, the sky appears to be covered by millions of fireflies
While the ground is probably a think layer of disturbingly large bugs.
That does sound really nice though. That's sort of where I spent most weekend nights while I was in high school.
I was in the venture crew that took care of a nearby Cub Scout camp.
I don't really notice large bugs covering the ground. There are bugs, sure
I was joking (mostly).
mostly the airborne type
I do want to restate how I appreciate your offer. It's nice when a girl is comfortable to ask a guy out.
I feel that in many cases they just don't feel like it's their role. They assume that the guy should be the one asking them out, especially in the beginning
I don't think I'm capable of waiting that much.
waiting? It's been 2 days
I don't mean in this specific instance; I mean overall.
Once my interest is truly piqued, I'll push for whatever I want, more or less.
that is how it should be
otherwise you are in denial, or lazy
Or way too passive to be useful.
I was guessing you where the latter
Lazy or passive? lol
and I was pretty sure you were never going ask me out initially
passive

Well, for the initial encounter, I wouldn't have asked you---I like guys who can take initiative. If you're too shy to ask me out, then I assume that's fairly indicative of your personality. And if you don't come across as shy and you don't ask me out, I assume you're not that interested.
which was I?
The latter.
Showertime...brb
12:00 shower? -.-
yuppers
I went running this morning and never got around to it til now
I kind of envy your lack of set schedule, but I know I wouldn't be able to deal with it myself.
I need routine of some sort.
Or I become a useless human being lol
I suppose I am a useless human being from time to time
FYI: I like the new pic. Very cute :-)
Thanks. ^_^
ok, well that report is finished
almost lunchtime now
I just ate lunch... need to go to the bank soon
the bank? what the hell do you need to do at the bank?
Deposit a check
they have machines that do that now
I still have to go to the bank to find them. =P
after reading my old blogs last night, I feel somewhat inspired to write
So you were saying. What are you going to do about it?
Coincidentally, I just found this article. http://writingxlns.wordpress.com/?goback=.gde_88594_member_25972629
Ugh, now that I skim it in a little more dept, it seems fairly useless. But maybe you'll get something out of it anyway? =/
well, I've got nothing
I want to write, but I'm drawing a blank
I'd suggest trolling through some news sites. Find something that you want to say something about.
I've kinda got something
CNN Money and/or Wired Threat Level are usually good ones for me on monetary/political issues.
there isn't much in current events that really interest me at the moment
I have my moments where I am very into politics, now is not one of them.
Yeah, same.
I'm usually pretty apathetic, but certain things will trigger an urge to crusade almost.
word
I really like the blog about oil
because I sound so passionate about it
I want to be passionate about what I write. Sometimes I just not feeling particularly passionate about anything
Can't be passionate all the time... and if you wait for it, you'll have long gaps between posts.
My posts are/were usually based on responses to particular articles, not on a general topic that I wanted to talk about. Maybe that structure could work for you? =/
yeah, I need to remind myself that not every post has to be long and memorable
True.
You also need to keep in mind what audience you're targeting/writing for.
I have no audience
whoever feels like reading it, I don't really care
Well, pinpointing a general audience you hope will be interested is kind of a first step.
It doesn't have to be a real audience, or confined to a specific demographic. It's just a tool you can use.
Like the food blogs I follow are targeting 2 separate audiences.
101 Cookbooks is all about cooking with 'natural' foods, and is mostly vegan/vegetarian.
To a lesser extent, it targets people who are interested in photography and the San Fransisco area.

Simply Recipes is all about cooking for a family and enjoying the food you make. They are usually simple-ish recipes and somewhat healthy, but it's a lot less restrictive. Another big aspect is cooking and how it fits into family bonding and family traditions.
While all of my stuff is directed for my friends, I tend to discuss social/gender issues that are affecting the children of today and have the potential to drastically affect the future of society.
Or I find instances where people are acting in an incredibly stupid way that I feel harms society... and that's more just like "this is fucking stupid, and here's exactly why."
I like that last part
I feel that my oil blog is very much like that
At some point if I were to continue blogging I would like it to be more structured and have more of a target audience, but for now it's more for me to just be creative and write about whatever
But you're not writing at all. ^_^
then if I were to start
I'd like to journal, but it feels too forced to me
There is something to be said for the randomness of not having a set time to write
Yeah, depends on how you operate.
Discipline is probably the only way that would work for me---setting a routine and sticking by it.
yeah, I have started to embrace the unpredictableness of life
/poke
umm....started....that was a few years ago
but thats another story
O.o
What?
I have simplified my life as much as possible
I like not always having a schedule/routine to follow.
Yeah. It works for some people.
but not really, cause I do have deadlines
But there's still flexibility in how/when those are achieved.
sure to some extent but they still exist

let's see, so yesterday I had to pull the battery from my boss's car because he set off the alarm. Today I hooked up his cable box and set it up. Now we are going over to his sister-in-law's to pick up a dresser
Just an average week here at Delgado Appraisal
gotta run....toddles
bahahah. Toodles*
you dare mock my misspelling
1) Of course. 2) I didn't mock; I simply took amusement in the spelling. 3) You would too if you said it out loud in the same way you'd say "toodles."
And it will continue to amuse me for the rest of the day.
well I am glad that I amuse you
I would say, overall, you are pretty entertaining, in a variety of ways.
as in...funny looking
HAHA. I did not think of that one, but sure.
We can go with that.
I was thinking more "charming and challenging conversationalist" and/or "engaging sense of humor" etc.
But "your face" is definitely also an acceptable answer, imo.
I'm not sure that's a compliment...but I'll take it
The first two are fairly clearly compliments. The "your face" was tying back to your immediate response of "funny looking."
I was thinking more like my face in entertaining
Hm. I have no good way to word a response to that, so you'll have to settle for a shrug and a smile.
/shrug
again, I'll take it
kudos to me for my multitasking abilities
I will not give kudos until I know what you were multitasking.
working, listening to music, helping the kids play a dvd, talking to my cousin, and chatting with you
"the kids"?
Belonging to your cousin, I assume?
Or did you just kidnap a couple from the neighborhood?
you assume correctly, they are my cousin's kids
http://www.time.com/time/nation/article/0,8599,2008127,00.html
don't you think I have enough to do?
you want to me to read an article too?
You can save it for later. It looked like something you might find interesting.
it's also time for me to eat again, so throw that on the plate
Plates are good to put food on.
I have confidence that you can manage it all.
What's your take on the lunar landing?
It's not really my thing
How do you mean?
I don't do it
but I guess if I had to
like if I were running low on fuel
Oh man.
but I try to stay out of situations like that
Note to self: be more explicit.
that could be taken many different ways
Yes, I was going to add "But not in language"... =/
perhaps you should've taken your own advise
dammit advice
What side do you take in the great moon landing of 1969? Did it or did it not happen?
I dunno
I wasn't there
No opinion on the matter?
I am generally skeptical of things that I have no way of confirming. If I had to guess I would say it did. There seems to be a substancial amount of evidence to support it, but anything is possible
/nod
More or less how I see it.
it comes down to why go through the trouble of mocking it up
Oh, propaganda, are you kidding?
There is more than enough motive.
Cold War era... Russia was getting 'ahead' of us the space race.
We needed something to prove that Americans were still superior.
yeah but it would such a huge conspiracy
I can totally see the reason for mocking it up.
True.
But it'd be worth the risk to fake it, as long as they could keep it covered up for long enough.
Was 16 years before the Cold War ended though... that's a long time to hope you can keep a secret.
All this said, I still have a weird instinctive feeling that it did happen. /shrug
I don't really think about it that much
I think more about the fact that it was the last time we did anything noteworthy
We should be heading to Mars by now
Fuck, I'd like to see people land on the moon again.
Manned spaceflight is obviously achievable.
I'm not convinced that we have/had the technology to land on the moon and return from it.

Anyway, I don't want to come across as a conspiracy nut or anything. Someone else mentioned the lunar landing in reference to my status, and I was talking to a friend about it. Decided to probe (seems appropriate) your opinion on the matter.
that's what I mean, we don't have the technology to land/return from the moon, and that's kinda bullshit
that said, I don't think we should be waisting our time on the moon anyway
Been there, done that. Onward to Mars!
Hah
Hm, to take you to the biweekly training thing or not.
I guess I could take notes on my laptop.
And I _do_ have work that I can do.
I don't know what you are talking about
That's okay
for you
And that's all that matters

I work for a consulting company. Every other week or so, the consultants in this branch have a training session on some aspect of our services. I usually go because the knowledge directly affects how well/thoroughly I can edit our proposals.
I decided to bring my laptop this time. =P
Someone just gave me a note, but I didn't see who it was.... >.>
that seems like a reasonable decision
I thought so.
Ahh, it was the corporate trainer!
The note is "Here you go enhancing your knowledge again! :)"
I was a little weirded out.
I'm having a hard time taking my job seriously right now
Why?
it's kind of a joke sometimes. Right now I am appraising a house I already appraised about 3 months ago
It seems quite pointless to me
Well, the value of the house could adjust quite a lot in 3 months...sometimes...
Do you need your job to have a point?
I don't. I wouldn't mind if it did though. I'd like to have more purpose at work
Understandable.
huh, now there's pizza here
great, and I just had a protein bar an hour ago
Mmm, pizza.
Haven't eaten since 12 =(
yeah, it's kind of a weakness
yea I eat every 3 hours
except when I am sleeping
then I eat every 4 hours
Ha.
I have to maintain my high metabolism
Good call.
nearly died this morning running
O.o
Freak snowstorm?
no, it started to rain though, and then it stopped. I kinda wish it would have rained
How does that equate to almost dying?
Exaggerate much?
I think I just overexerted myself
and now I am eating pizza
I'm jealous.
What toppings do you usually get on your pizza?
spinach, mushrooms, kalamata olives, feta cheese
Wow. I just got a fantastic headache.
from my pizza toppings?
Nope.
Though I'm not sure how I feel about your toppings.
Mostly because I'm not sure what my opinion is on feta cheese.
well, it does depend on how healthy I am being
Oh?
though healthy pizza is typically an oxymoron
so in some cases Im happy with pepperoni
For the longest time I was happy with just cheese.
Still am, really.
My usual toppings are peppers, onions, ham, and bacon when I have the chance. I'm usually perfectly happy without the meat though, as well.
Typically prefer veggies to meat when it comes to pizza.
ohh I can't really do the peppers and onions
a little onion is ok
Not a fan of the flavors?
it's not really that, they just don't agree with me
Ah
This training is way less useful than I thought it would be.
ahhh, Ben Harper on the iTunes, one of my favs
Have not heard.
I would send links, but probably would not help if your in training
....you're
Email some or link later tonight.
Can't see YouTube stuff from work anyway =(
BOOOOO
http://today.msnbc.msn.com/id/38572863/ns/today-today_people?GT1=43001
Interesting. Will read that later. When there isn't a service center director sitting behind me.
it's weird, the dude is hideous, and the 2nd wife quite attractive
Is he rich?
I'm guessing so
There ya go.
women are so shallow
Don't be insulting.
Humans are shallow.
relax
Im messin'
money can buy love
Money can buy a willful suspension of criteria.
It's like a scale...
The more money on the scale, the fewer criteria someone has to meet.
Assuming a shallow perspective.
not real love, but a synthesized version of love that the person excepts as love
Accepts
Yes.
Infatuation can feel like love if you don't know the difference.
It's nice having my own personal editor handy
Yeah, infatuation with money
If it irks you that I point out homophone/spelling errors, just tell me and I'll stop.
I don't do it as a "ha-ha! you made a mistake" thing.
normally I dont care, but sometimes I kick myself for making an obvious mistake
Everyone does it.
My fingers have weird word defaults--especially with homophones.
Im not overly concerned when it comes to chatting/txt
Yeah.
well Ive got to run
few errands, then hopefully a nice relaxing evening at home
Have fun with that
O.o
I don't know what to think of that face tied to that comment.
ha. Cya
Enjoy your "errands"? >.>
you know how I know you're gay?
How?
you have a rainbow bumper sticker on your car that says "I love it when balls are in my face."
baha
happy friday
Indeed
Good morning. =)
oh yeah, what's so good about it?
Talking to you? ;)
It's a good morning because it's a Friday morning. And that means tomorrow is not Friday morning.
yeah but on thurs tomorrow will be friday morning
And that's why Thursdays suck.
yeah but they are right before friday, which suck less
I don't know... I've never really liked Tuesdays and Thursdays.
They're my least favorite days of the week usually.
they got nothing on mondays
I usually don't mind Mondays.
They're like the rain... almost always inconvenient, but a fact of life that you have no control over. May as well just accept it and move on.
often times I find myself daydreaming about my weekend on mondays
it makes it seem almost surreal.
I need to stop reading advice columns.
They just highlight how absolutely fucked in the head people are.
"My boyfriend got a tattoo... should I dump him?!"

"My boyfriend of 3 years and father of my child wants to exclude his alcoholic mother who terrorized him as a child from our baby's life. I think he's wrong, so I've been secretly allowing his mother to visit the baby... Is this the right thing to do?"
What. the. hell.
1. Yes, you should dump him. Not because he got a tattoo, you just want to dump him and are using it as an excuse.
Seriously.
If nothing else, if it really disturbs you that badly, just suck it up and go find someone without body art.
It's not wrong to have personal preferences.
Granted, I think that's a pretty stupid thing to get freaked out over, but hey, whatever makes her happy.
2. Sure, but if/when he asks you to marry him, come clean about how you secretly did this behind his back even after he explicitly told you he didn't want her involved. See if he reconsiders.
Ugh. I just can't understand it.
How fucking disrespectful.
I don't understand how people can be "in love" and not care enough about their S.O.'s feelings and judgements to adhere to them or stand by them.
and if you need to ask if something is "the right thing to do", maybe you should of asked that question BEFORE you went ahead and did it
Yeaaaaah.
Utterly vapid
